00023   struct RecList
00024   {
00025     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;
00026     virtual int getSize() = 0;
00027     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const = 0;
00028 
00029     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00030     {
00031         std::string lowerCase;
00032 
00033         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00034             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00035 
00036         return lowerCase;
00037     }
00038   };

00042   template <typename X>
00043   struct RecListT : RecList
00044   {
00045     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00046 
00047     MapType list;
00048 
00049     // Load one object of this type
00050     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00051     {
00052       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00053       list[id2].load(esm);
00054     }
00055 
00056     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00057     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00058     {
00059         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00060 
00061         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00062 
00063         if (iter == list.end())
00064             return NULL;
00065 
00066         return &iter->second;
00067     }
00068 
00069     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00070     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00071     {
00072         const X *object = search (id);
00073 
00074         if (!object)
00075             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00076 
00077         return object;
00078     }
00079 
00080     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00081 
00082     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00083     {
00084         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00085             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00086     }
00087   };

00188   /* Land textures are indexed by an integer number
00189    */
00190   struct LTexList : RecList
00191   {
00192     // TODO: For multiple ESM/ESP files we need one list per file.
00193     std::vector<LandTexture> ltex;
00194     int count;
00195 
00196     LTexList() : count(0)
00197     {
00198       // More than enough to hold Morrowind.esm.
00199       ltex.reserve(128);
00200     }
00201 
00202     int getSize() { return count; }
00203 
00204     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00205 
00206     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00207     {
00208       LandTexture lt;
00209       lt.load(esm);
00210       lt.id = id;
00211 
00212       // Make sure we have room for the structure
00213       if(lt.index + 1 > (int)ltex.size())
00214         ltex.resize(lt.index+1);
00215 
00216       // Store it
00217       ltex[lt.index] = lt;
00218     }
00219   };

00221   /* Landscapes are indexed by the X,Y coordinates of the exterior
00222      cell they belong to.
00223    */
00224   struct LandList : RecList
00225   {
00226     // Map containing all landscapes
00227     typedef std::map<int, Land*> LandsCol;
00228     typedef std::map<int, LandsCol> Lands;
00229     Lands lands;
00230 
00231     int count;
00232     LandList() : count(0) {}
00233     int getSize() { return count; }
00234 
00235     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00236 
00237     // Find land for the given coordinates. Return null if no data.
00238     const Land *search(int x, int y) const
00239     {
00240       Lands::const_iterator it = lands.find(x);
00241       if(it==lands.end())
00242         return NULL;
00243 
00244       LandsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find(y);
00245       if(it2 == it->second.end())
00246         return NULL;
00247 
00248       return it2->second;
00249     }
00250 
00251     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00252     {
00253       count++;
00254 
00255       // Create the structure and load it. This actually skips the
00256       // landscape data and remembers the file position for later.
00257       Land *land = new Land;
00258       land->load(esm);
00259 
00260       // Store the structure
00261       lands[land->X][land->Y] = land;
00262     }
00263   };
00264 
00265     struct ciLessBoost : std::binary_function<std::string, std::string, bool>
00266 {
00267     bool operator() (const std::string & s1, const std::string & s2) const {
00268                                                //case insensitive version of is_less
00269         return lexicographical_compare(s1, s2, is_iless());
00270     }
00271 };

00274   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00275   // separately.
00276   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00277   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00278   struct CellList : RecList
00279   {
00280     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00281     int count;
00282     CellList() : count(0) {}
00283     int getSize() { return count; }
00284 
00285     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00286     typedef std::map<std::string,ESM::Cell*, ciLessBoost> IntCells;
00287     IntCells intCells;
00288 
00289     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00290     typedef std::map<std::pair<int, int>, ESM::Cell*> ExtCells;
00291     ExtCells extCells;
00292 
00293     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00294     {
00295         for (IntCells::const_iterator iter (intCells.begin()); iter!=intCells.end(); ++iter)
00296             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00297     }
00298 
00299     ~CellList()
00300     {
00301       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00302         delete it->second;
00303 
00304       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00305           delete it->second;
00306     }
00307 
00308     const ESM::Cell* searchInt(const std::string &id) const
00309     {
00310       IntCells::const_iterator iter = intCells.find(id);
00311 
00312       if (iter!=intCells.end())
00313         return iter->second;
00314 
00315       return 0;
00316     }
00317 
00318     const ESM::Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00319     {
00320       const ESM::Cell *cell = searchInt (id);
00321 
00322       if (!cell)
00323          throw std::runtime_error ("Interior cell not found - " + id);
00324 
00325       return cell;
00326     }
00327 
00328     const ESM::Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00329     {
00330         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (std::make_pair (x, y));
00331 
00332         if (it==extCells.end())
00333             return 0;
00334 
00335         return it->second;
00336     }
00337 
00338     const ESM::Cell *findExt (int x, int y) const
00339     {
00340         const ESM::Cell *cell = searchExt (x, y);
00341 
00342         if (!cell)
00343             throw std::runtime_error ("Exterior cell not found");
00344 
00345         return cell;
00346     }
00347     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00348     {
00349         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00350         {
00351             if (toLower (iter->second->name) == toLower (id))
00352                 return iter->second;
00353         }
00354 
00355         return 0;
00356     }
00357 
00358     const ESM::Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00359     {
00360         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00361 
00362         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00363             if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00364                 return iter->second;
00365 
00366         return 0;
00367     }
00368 
00369     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00370     {
00371       count++;
00372 
00373       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00374       ESM::Cell *cell = new ESM::Cell;
00375       cell->name = id;
00376 
00377       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00378       cell->load(esm);
00379 
00380       if(cell->data.flags & ESM::Cell::Interior)
00381         {
00382           // Store interior cell by name
00383           intCells[id] = cell;
00384         }
00385       else
00386         {
00387           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00388           extCells[std::make_pair (cell->data.gridX, cell->data.gridY)] = cell;
00389         }
00390     }
00391   };

00393   template <typename X>
00394   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00395   {
00396     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00397 
00398     MapType list;
00399 
00400     // Load one object of this type
00401     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00402     {
00403       X ref;
00404       ref.load (esm);
00405 
00406       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00407 
00408       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00409     }
00410 
00411     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00412     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00413     {
00414         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00415 
00416         typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id2);
00417 
00418         if (iter == list.end())
00419             return NULL;
00420 
00421         return &iter->second;
00422     }
00423 
00424     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00425     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00426     {
00427         const X *object = search (id);
00428 
00429         if (!object)
00430             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00431 
00432         return object;
00433     }
00434 
00435     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00436 
00437     virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const
00438     {
00439         for (typename MapType::const_iterator iter (list.begin()); iter!=list.end(); ++iter)
00440             identifier.push_back (iter->first);
00441     }
00442   };

00444   template <typename X>
00445   struct IndexListT
00446   {
00447         typedef std::map<int, X> MapType;
00448 
00449         MapType list;
00450 
00451         void load(ESMReader &esm)
00452         {
00453             X ref;
00454             ref.load (esm);
00455             int index = ref.index;
00456             list[index] = ref;
00457         }
00458 
00459         int getSize()
00460         {
00461             return list.size();
00462         }
00463 
00464         virtual void listIdentifier (std::vector<std::string>& identifier) const {}
00465 
00466         // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00467         const X* search (int id) const
00468         {
00469             typename MapType::const_iterator iter = list.find (id);
00470 
00471             if (iter == list.end())
00472                 return NULL;
00473 
00474             return &iter->second;
00475         }
00476 
00477         // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00478         const X* find (int id) const
00479         {
00480             const X *object = search (id);
00481 
00482             if (!object)
00483             {
00484                 std::ostringstream error;
00485                 error << "object " << id << " not found";
00486                 throw std::runtime_error (error.str());
00487             }
00488 
00489             return object;
00490         }
00491   };
